messages: 28864ca5cc64ba8f757768f021e12cfe (00:38): I'm running Blender 2.41 on Ubuntu Dapper 6.06 and I'm getting horrible screen interface corruption.
28864ca5cc64ba8f757768f021e12cfe (00:38): It's not the "colors are whacked out" problem I managed to dig up online.
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:38): and are you using ubuntu's blender or the blender3d 'official' distribution?
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:39): I wouldn't trust what's available via apt
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:39): plus we're up to 2.42 now, so start by seeing if that fixes your problem
e1da244fe842f5ecb134728ab4f22fcc (00:39): AdmiralSenn: MPHIII is that amazing sound that comes when you make pressure in your mouth, and the lips are being tightened
28864ca5cc64ba8f757768f021e12cfe (00:39): I had trouble with Ubuntu's version, and now I'm using the one that's packaged with 'blender2crystal' from delcorp.org
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:40): try just using blender.org's official 2.42 release
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:40): well, it SHOULDN'T be the problem, but it could be
e1da244fe842f5ecb134728ab4f22fcc (00:40): AdmiralSenn: MPHIII could be the sound George Bush is making here: http://www.allhatnocattle.net/New_Folder/TightLips.jpg
e1da244fe842f5ecb134728ab4f22fcc (00:41): imaging George Bush blowing while his lips are in that way
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:44): well, you probably can, but it's not as much fun as ham
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:44): plus once you eat it you have to reinstall it
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:46): it's a combination of having a crappy network card and having a slow machine
e1da244fe842f5ecb134728ab4f22fcc (00:49): Where do you live then?
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:50): I'm not allowed to reveal that information.
e1da244fe842f5ecb134728ab4f22fcc (00:50): and the bonus question: Do you have a blender?
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:51): I have the software AND the hardware
e1da244fe842f5ecb134728ab4f22fcc (00:52): And now, it's time for coffee in the garden : )
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:53): that's the last render I did
3f4387e15113f958fd3b902686d2dc00 (00:54): i've been doing low-poly "game" stuff, haha
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:54): I have to get the modeling down
6bdf4521165fe0d0fae23a0112289d95 (00:54): do high poly for prerendered game stuff :)
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:54): although those colors are basically what it will look like
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:55): with the addition, perhaps, of some battle scarring and so on
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:55): and no, those nozzles in the middle aren't weapons
3f4387e15113f958fd3b902686d2dc00 (00:56): just got blender 3 days ago, starting REALLY simple :P
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:57): we don't want to know about your personal life dude
3f4387e15113f958fd3b902686d2dc00 (00:57): modeling is much less intimidating than it seemed when i was an outsider~
0f898700e81f53ceddc543addc5844ae (00:58): wish i had a enough lego to make something good when i was a kid
3f4387e15113f958fd3b902686d2dc00 (00:59): i had a ton of them, but they were like really really old basic blocks
3f4387e15113f958fd3b902686d2dc00 (00:59): couldn't really use them for anything cool
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:59): I had a mixture of useless stuff and modern ones
3f4387e15113f958fd3b902686d2dc00 (00:59): because the clashing colours made me cry
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (00:59): like my church had a garage sale and they had most of an airport kit or something
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (01:00): so I used that to make a swing-wing high speed personal jet
0f898700e81f53ceddc543addc5844ae (01:00): a know a guy who had buckets and buckets and he make space stations that did things like make coffee for you
0f898700e81f53ceddc543addc5844ae (01:01): i saw on discovery, you can get this lego 3d program and make prototypes for them to sell
3f4387e15113f958fd3b902686d2dc00 (01:01): that program is so depressingly limited
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (01:01): or get the Blender lego script
3f4387e15113f958fd3b902686d2dc00 (01:03): has pretty much every lego piece ever and great CAD features
87103c73f1d4ebce7a0d0f7cc72fd19d (01:09): a single update for adobe reader requires 4 reboots
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (01:15): awesome enough that, since it came from Canada, I shall no longer make Canada-related jokes
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (01:16): Jones Soda... I've had it before but it's been years since I've had a bottle of vanilla cola
